title: Safety and security of humanitarian personnel and protection of United Nations personnel
text:
United Nations 
A/80/L.19
 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: Limited 
26 November 2025 
Original: English 
 
25-19373 (E)    021225     
*2519373* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
Agenda item 72 (a) 
Strengthening of the coordination of humanitarian and 
disaster relief assistance of the United Nations, including 
special economic assistance: strengthening of the coordination 
of emergency humanitarian assistance of the United Nations 
 
 
 
Russian Federation:* amendment to draft resolution A/80/L.18 
 
 
Safety and security of humanitarian personnel and protection of 
United Nations personnel 
 
 
 
Delete the thirty-eighth preambular paragraph reading: 
 
Recalling the inclusion of attacks intentionally directed against personnel 
involved in a humanitarian assistance or peacekeeping mission in accordance with 
the Charter, as long as they are entitled to the protection given to civilians or civilian 
objects under the international law of armed conflict, as a war crime in the Rome 
Statute of the International Criminal Court,** and noting the role that the Court can 
play in appropriate cases in bringing to justice those responsible for serious violations 
of international humanitarian law, 
 
 
 
* Any changes to the list of sponsors will be reflected in the official record of the meeting. 
 
** United Nations, Treaty Series, vol. 2187, No. 38544.
